column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=Autophagy , a self-eating process , is involved in the development and the differentiation of various cell types including the adipocyte .

#Text=Autophagy contributes to the adipocyte differentiation by reorganizing the intracellular components , forming the fat droplets and/or providing the energy source for the development of the phenotype .
#Text=Therefore , the knockdown of essential autophagy genes prevents the adipocyte differentiation and intervenes in the lipid accumulation within adipogenic cells .
#Text=The adipocyte differentiation is a well-understood process .
#Text=A well defined transcriptional program is initiated and maintained by specific transcription factors .
#Text=The 3T3-L1 mouse fibroblast is a key model for studying this process .

#Text=When the pre-adipocyte is induced with a chemical cocktail containing MDI ( 1-Methyl-3-isobutylxanthine , Dexamethasone , and Insulin ) , the cell witnesses morphological and metabolic changes and is finally transformed into mature adipocyte .
#Text=Several studies reported functional links between the adipogenic factors and key autophagy genes .
#Text=For example , the transcription factor CCAAT enhancer-binding protein beta ( CEBPB ) controls the expression of the autophagy-related 4b cysteine peptidase ( Atg4b ) .

#Text=A recent study suggested that peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma ( PPARG ) regulates autophagy through NEDD4 E3 ubiquitin protein ligase ( NEDD4 ) gene expression in thiazolidinediones-treated HepG2 cells .
#Text=Forkhead box o1 ( FOXO1 ) regulates autophagy induction and it also negatively regulates Pparg , the master adipogenic factor .
#Text=Indeed , the inhibition of FOXO1 is thus necessary for the differentiation to proceed .

#Text=In a previous study from our laboratory , we reported the progressive activation of the Foxo1 gene during the course of differentiation , to reach the highest expression in the mature adipocytes .
#Text=In addition , we identified a large number of differentially expressed autophagy genes between differentiated and undifferentiated adipocytes .
#Text=The changes in gene expression were clustered into several groups that corresponded to the known stages of adipocyte differentiation .
#Text=Therefore , the regulation of autophagy during the course of the differentiation seems to be more dynamic and stage-dependant .
#Text=Only a few examples of direct and indirect regulation of autophagy genes have been studied .
#Text=We hypothesize that the autophagy process may be regulated by the same adipogenic factors either directly or indirectly through specific autophagy transcription factors .
#Text=To investigate this hypothesis , we modeled the gene expression and transcription factors and co-factors binding at different stages of adipocyte maturation (
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=) .
#Text=Then , we studied the direct regulatory links between the adipogenic transcription factors and key autophagy genes as well as specific autophagy transcription factors .
#Text=We were able to quantify the changes in the global expression of autophagy genes as the pre-adipocytes progressed toward the maturation stage .
#Text=We considered changes at both the individual gene and the gene set levels .
#Text=Then , we investigated the links between the master adipogenic transcription factors and the observed changes in gene expression .
#Text=We tested whether the established links hold in the knockdown condition of the adipogenic factors .
#Text=In addition , the role of transcription co-factors and histone modifications in modulating the function of the transcription factor was discussed .
